title: How to watch and live stream the Vuelta a España 2023
content:
Cyclist
How to watch and live stream the Vuelta a España 2023

The 78th Vuelta a España starts on Saturday 26th August in Barcelona with a 14.6km team time-trial. The route dips into Andorra and France and includes seven mountain stages, six hilly stages and four flat stages and finishes with a sprint in Madrid. The race will cover 3,153.8km of racing with the penultimate stage the longest at 208km – and it features over 4,000m of climbing.

Headlining the start list is defending champion Remco Evenepoel of Soudal-QuickStep. After dropping out of the Giro with Covid while leading the race, Evenepoel swapped his Road Race World Champion’s jersey with the time-trial rainbows so is coming to repeat his success at the Vuelta with good form.

However Jumbo-Visma are looking to thwart his plan and become the first men’s team to complete the Grand Tour triple following Primož Roglič‘s win at the Giro d’Italia and Jonas Vingegaard‘s at the Tour de France. Roglič and Vingegaard will take to the start line in Barcelona as co-leaders with an incredibly strong team including superdomestique Sepp Kuss, Dylan van Baarle and Jan Tratnik.

It promises to be a fantastic final three weeks of Grand Tour racing with appearances from the Col du Tourmalet on Stage 13 and the Alto de l’Angliru on Stage 17.

How can I watch the Vuelta a España 2023?

In the UK, live coverage of the 2023 Vuelta a España can be found on Eurosport 1 and 2, GCN+ and Discovery+.

The Eurosport coverage is streamed on Discovery+ and GCN+; these services offer uninterrupted live coverage. GCN+ costs £6.99 paid monthly, or £39.99 per year; Discovery+ and Eurosport Player are now the same service and cost £6.99 per month or £59.99 per year for sports and entertainment (for fans of shows like Wheeler Dealers and Naked and Afraid). The GCN+ coverage will be available in select territories worldwide including Australia, check GCN’s list of each country’s schedule to avoid disappointment.

USA viewers can watch the race on CNBC or purchase a Peacock Premium subscription, ad-free with Peacock Premium Plus for $9.99 a month. FloBikes will be providing coverage in Canada on their website and FloSports apps. In Australia, SBS will be broadcasting the race, while viewers in New Zealand can catch the action on Sky.
